title: How to deal with a Fear of Ranked?
body:
Hey! I'm a Silver 2 player who's looking to get to gold or higher. But for some reason, I always get very scared to queue up. I don't want to play ranked with friends because I'm not a boosted animal, but I'll play it sometimes with them. Even if it's with friends, I always get so scared and anxious when I queue up. Maybe it's because unlike Normals, there's something on the line and if I lose, it's a bigger consequence. Sometimes I get freaked out if people start to flame me and feel like I'm not good enough to climb.
Anyone have any recommendations about dealing with this fear of ranked queue and and prevent myself from tilting?

replies.body:
Competitive play is prone to causing these types of emotions. When I play ranked in League or competitive in CS:GO, my palms get pretty sweaty (mom's spaghetti) and I sometimes feel like my heart rate may be reaching dangerous levels, but it's really just nerves. Some methods for calming these nerves that work for me are listening to music that puts me in *the zone* or having some of my favourite snacks close by so I can snack away during teleports back to base.

I hope one of those work for you, please let me know if you have any questions.

P.S. [Here's a link](https://open.spotify.com/user/armadamusicofficial/playlist/5lSgExb6yTKfLusGag7bm7) to the Spotify Playlist that puts me in *the zone*.
What do you do for anxiety and what snacks

I'd say pretty much the same thing, except the music would be more calming, something with some light piano or atmospheric sounds. Snacks would probably be pita chips and hummus or white cheddar popcorn. :)

Hmm I am not sure but really normal draft is basically the same as ranked... just without the whole LP and rank thing at the end game screen
So there isn't really any need to care so much about it after all in game is the same and not like rank actually matter all that much? (I don't think so anyways)

Stick to your best pick, not your team's best pick at this elo.
If you fear flame, mute everyone who has tendencies to flame and play focusing on the match ;)

For me I set my self a number of games to play per night when I can actually play League and just played them. Currently this is close to two games a week because of Uni and Stardew Valley updating. Mostly though if you just play one or two ranked games and know that you're not going to overdo it it's not too bad losing one game isn't that daunting, especially if you've won recently.
